sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: "An ideal refrigerator operates between -10°C and 30°C, with a cooling rate of 500 J/s. If the power consumed by the refrigerator is 2000 W, what is the coefficient of performance of the refrigerator?"
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a refrigerator is defined as the ratio of the cooling effect (Q_c) to the work input (W). In this case, the cooling rate is given as 500 J/s, and the power consumed by the refrigerator is 2000 W (which is equivalent to 2000 J/s). 

COP = Q_c / W

Plugging in the values:

COP = (500 J/s) / (2000 J/s)

COP = 0.25

The coefficient of performance of the refrigerator is 0.25.
